metadata.title: CVE-2022-48952 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:PCI: mt7621: Add sentinel to quirks tableCurrent driver is missing a sentinel in the struct soc_device_attributearray, which causes an oops when assessed by thesoc_device_match(mt7621_pcie_quirks_match) call.This was only exposed once the CONFIG_SOC_MT7621 mt7621 soc_dev_attrwas fixed to register the SOC as a device, in:commit 7c18b64bba3b ("mips: ralink: mt7621: do not use kzalloc too early")Fix it by adding the required sentinel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic-64k - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-aws - 5.15.0-1033.37~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-azure - 5.15.0-1035.42~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1035.42~20.04.1.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1031-gcp - 5.15.0-1031.38~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-gkeop - 5.15.0-1017.22~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-ibm - 5.15.0-1033.36~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1027-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1027.32~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-lowlatency - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-69.76~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1032-oracle - 5.15.0-1032.38~20.04.1
No subscription required
